entry.string: Administration - XarTinyMCE
Overview
What is it?
XarTinyMCE is a Xaraya Module based on TinyMCE, a platform independent web based Javascript HTML WYSIWYG editor released as Open Source under LGPL by Moxiecode Systems AB
xarTinyMCE module integrates the TinyMCE application by

for use within your Xaraya web site. This module allows configuration options via the GUI in the Xaraya Administration area for xarTinyMCE.  It has a number of nice features over similar editors, with  multiple browser support, (currently Mozilla, MSIE and FireFox) and support for XHTML 1.0 strict markup. There are powerful features for not only allowing or disallowing xhtml tags (like the Xaraya HTML module), but also what attributes, and  attribute values to allow. You can enhance xarTinyMCE further with plugins!
How to use it?
Install this module like you would any other Xaraya module. That is:
put the tinymce folder in your Xaraya modules directory
go to the Adminpanel menu -> Modules -> View All
Click on the "install" link of the tinymce module
The XarTinyMCE editor is not turned on by default. Once the tinymce module is installed it needs to be turned on. You can now do this in the XarTinyMCE Module Configuration area or:
go to the Adminpanels menu -> Base -> Modify Config
choose the tab "Other"
on the wysiwyg editor dropdown choose "tinymce" as the default editor
You can use XarTinyMCE module to enable wysiwyg in two basic ways (there are variations on these).

You can become more specific by choosing the Mode of "Special Labelled Only" in the configuration options. You must then also add the attribute: mce_editable="true" to any "textarea" or "div" tag that you wish to use as a WYSIWYG textarea. You can do this easily by using the xarTinyMCE Dynamic Data Property (see below).
Dynamic Data Property

A xarTinyMCE Dynamic Data WYSIWYG textarea is also available and works with All Textareas or Special Labelled text area mode. To use this, add a XarTinyMCE GUI Dynamic Data field to your publication type (or other module) in the usual way. You do not add a xarTinyMCE tag to your template when you use a xarTInyMCE DD field.
Set row height and column width in the validation field. eg 20:80 for 20 rows high, 80 columns wide. If you can't see the xarTinyMCE GUI DD property in your DD list then
This causes a re-read of all DD properties available to Xaraya
Plug Ins

There are a number of plugins available to add on to xarTinyMCE. Add the plugin name to the Plug in list in the Modify Configuration settings. Some plugins require an extra button added in your Advanced Theme configuration, whereas others (like advimage and advlink) do not but require allowed element string added to appropriate configuration area. These include:

Image Browser (ibrowser) - browse your image libraries and select a file to insert to your textarea. Upload a file if you have allowed uploads in the configuration. See the configuration area for more detail
Emotions - click to add fancy emoticons
ISpell spell checker - only available for IE
Preview and Zoom - zoom is only available in IE
Time - click to add time in configured format
Date - click to add date in configured format
Flash - allows you to add flash files

Advanced Image - allows insert of rollover images. Add the advimg to Plugins, and img[class|style|src|border=0|alt|title|hspace|vspace|width|height|align|onmouseover|onmouseout] to the Additional Tags configuration
Advanced Link - allows insert of extended link tags, plus popup windows. Add advlink to Plugins, and a[id|name|href|style|title|onclick] to Additional Tags configuration.
Save - allows insert of a Save button. Add save to Plugins, and save to Additional Tags configuration.
Print - displays a Print function button. Add print to Plugins, and print to Additional Tags configuration.
Search and Replace - Search, Search Next and Replace function. Add searchreplace to Plugins, and search and/or replace to Additional Tags configuration.

Table - plug in to add table controls. Add table to Plugins, and either tablecontrols for all table controls, or the specific controls such as table, rowprops and so on, as per plugin documentation, to Additional Tags configuration.

Xaraya Page Break - icon click to add a Xaraya new page break to any of your publication type articles. Add xarpagebreak to Plugins, and xarpagebreak to Additional Tags configuration. Make sure you also allow images and appropriate attributes to view the pagebreak icon in your articles.
Included Blocks
There are no included blocks
Included Hooks
There are no included hooks
Further Information
Further information on xarTinyMCE can be found at
xarTinyMCE Extension page at
Click on Version History tab at the bottom to get the latest release information.
